thread.title: US trade deficit widens more than expected in June
thread.title_full: US trade deficit widens more than expected in June

title: US trade deficit widens more than expected in June
text:
Tip : Use comma (,) to separate multiple quotes. Learn more... 
Wed, Aug 5, 2015, 16:57 BST - UK Markets closed US trade deficit widens more than expected in June By Daniel Cancian | Sharecast â€“ 51 minutes ago 281.863 -0.2870 
LONDON (ShareCast) - (ShareCast News) - The US trade deficit rose beyond expectations in June, on the back of an increase in the import of automobiles and drugs from the European Union. The deficit rose 7.8% in June to $43.8bn from a revised $40.9bn in May and compared with analysts' expectations of a $42.8bn forecast, the Commerce Department said. 
According to figures released on Wednesday, exports declined 0.1% month-on-month to $188.6bn in June, while imports climbed 1.2% to $232.4bn compared with a 0.5% decline in the previous month. 
Real goods import rose 1% month-on-month from a 0.9% decline in May, leading the real good deficit to widen 4.5% month-on-month to $59.3bn. 
In the three months to June, the trade deficit averaged $41.8bn, a 2.5% decline year-on-year. 
"The revised trade data for May show a smaller monthly deficit, implying that net trade likely added a bit more to GDP growth in the second quarter than was initially estimated," analysts at Barclays (LSE: BARC.L - news ) said in a note. 
"This boosted our second quarter GDP tracking estimate very modestly, but after rounding it rose one-tenth to 3.0%."
